page.title: 03Religions in Longtown.
page.content: The Parish of Arthuret embraces farmland and Longtown,which only developed after 1840.The Church dates to 573 when the Christian King of Cumbria defeated the pagan king of Strathclyde at Arderryd.The Church was rebuilt around 1100 and 1609.3/4 of the 1000 homes are Anglican.There are small Presbyterian,Methodist, and Catholic Chapels.All Christians use Arthuret Churchyard and support each other.The resident Rector visits all Christians in hospital or home.Anglicans and Methodists provide a Sunday School and Youth Group.5% of the people worship,a tenth seek Children's Baptism and Christian Instruction.Half our couples seek Christian Marriage.Half our homes receive the monthly Parish Magazine.Care and visitation of the elderly is a feature of Longtown Life.
